case.name: Betts Group Pty Ltd v Paul's Retail Pty Ltd [2007] FCA 1983 (12 December 2007)

citphrases.citphrase: appeal from final application made to master of supreme court
whether affidavit relied on as demonstrating a genuine dispute about the subject of the demand was adequate
rules of the high court, o. 32, rr. 13, 18.
whether burden of discovery outweighs benefit
whether discovery relevant to pleaded issues
whether sufficient evidence to support order for further discovery
whether respondents should be directed to respond to applicant's notice to admit facts
whether leave should be granted to applicant to administer interrogatories
application for summary dismissal by respondents
whether reasonable prospect of success equity
applicant claims two reports on sea keeping of its vessels confidential

citances.sentence: However, in Slick v Westpac Banking Corporation (No 2) [2006] FCA 1712 at [43] , particular discovery was refused on the basis that 'the theoretical possibility that something might turn up [was] well and truly outweighed by the cost and burden to Westpac' (see also Betts [2007] FCA 1983). It is well established that generally a discovery affidavit is conclusive on the question of whether a party has or has had in its possession, custody or control of any relevant documents other than those discovered: Betts Group Pty Ltd v Paul's Retail Pty Ltd [2007] FCA 1983 at [15] ; Mulley v Manifold [1959] HCA 23 ; (1959) 103 CLR 341.
